title: Turkey Stuffed Acorn Squash
description: A quick, simple dish combining fall flavors perfect for Thanksgiving or using leftover turkey.

squash: Salt and ground black pepper (to taste)
stuffing: 3 cups spinach and/or kale, packed and coarsely chopped

instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F
Halve squash and place cut-side up on baking sheet; brush with oil, season with salt/pepper, bake 30 minutes
Brown avocado oil with onion and garlic until translucent
Add ground turkey, cook until browned; add remaining ingredients except cheese; stir in 1/2 cup cheese
Fill squash halves with stuffing mixture; top with remaining cheese
Bake 25 minutes until golden brown

title: French Potato and Leek Bisque
description: A French classic, ideal fall comfort dish for cozy evenings or afternoons indoors.
ingredients: 1 pound potatoes, peeled and roughly chopped into 1/2-inch pieces
Optional: sour cream and chives for garnish
instructions: Melt butter over medium heat in large pot
Add leeks and garlic; cook until wilted, stirring frequently without browning
Add potatoes, broth, bay leaves, and thyme; bring to boil
Cover, reduce heat to low, simmer 15 minutes until potatoes soften
Remove bay leaves; purée until smooth using immersion blender
Add heavy cream and simmer
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Optional garnish with sour cream and fresh chives

title: Weeknight Apple Pie
description: Easy as pie - can be assembled before dinner and baked while eating for a special dessert finish to any weeknight.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F
Peel, core, and chop apples into 1-inch chunks
Roll out one crust into 9" pan with loose edges
Cut second crust into 1"-wide strips and set aside
Mix all ingredients except egg with apples in large bowl
Pour apple mixture into pie pan
Weave remaining crust strips in alternating over-under pattern
Crimp edges together using finger and thumb with twisting motion
Whip egg and brush onto all exposed crust; sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar
Bake 50-60 minutes; cool 20 minutes before serving with vanilla ice cream

title: Thai Stir Fried Vegetables
description: A versatile stir-fry featuring fresh vegetables with coconut milk-based sauce. Soupier than typical stir-fries, can be served over rice or noodles.
instructions: Mix sauce ingredients in small bowl; stir until sugar dissolves; adjust flavoring
Heat wok/pan on medium-high; add oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili; stir-fry 1-2 minutes
Add carrots, mushrooms, 1/4 sauce; stir-fry 2-3 minutes
Add broccoli, pepper, more sauce; simmer 2 minutes
Add bok choy, sprouts, cashews, remaining sauce; simmer until bok choy is crisp-tender (2-3 minutes)
Top with fresh basil before serving

title: Garlic Roasted Brussels Sprouts
description: Caramelized brussels sprouts packed with Vitamins C and K, fiber, and cancer fighting anti-oxidants with only 10 calories per sprout.
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds fresh brussels sprouts (halved or quartered if large)
3 tablespoons olive oil or avocado oil
Pine nuts, chopped almonds, or walnuts (optional)
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F
Add brussels sprouts and onions to foil-lined baking pan
In small bowl, combine oil, garlic, salt, and pepper; drizzle over sprouts and toss to coat
Roast until tender, 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally
Optional: top with parmesan and/or nuts
Garnish with rosemary

title: Bananas Foster Pancakes
description: Decadent whole grain pancakes with a caramelized banana topping. Tasty treats that feel indulgent yet healthier due to whole grains.

pancakes: 1 cup rolled oats (pulsed in food processor)

instructions: Mix dry ingredients in large bowl
Whisk buttermilk, melted butter, and eggs in separate bowl
Slowly add wet to dry ingredients while whisking
Cook on buttered skillet or nonstick griddle
Slice bananas into 1/4-inch thick rings
Melt butter over medium-low heat; add bananas until softened
Flip slices; add brown sugar and spices
Cook until liquids become syrupy; remove from heat
Serve pancakes topped with melted peanut butter and bananas foster

title: Bacon Wrapped Asparagus
description: Elegant asparagus spears wrapped in scrumptious bacon entice even the pickiest eaters. Works as both appetizer and side.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F
Divide asparagus into bundles (3-4 pieces each); wrap one bacon slice around each bundle
Secure with toothpicks; place in baking pan
In saucepan, combine brown sugar, butter, soy sauce, and garlic salt; heat until boiling, stirring frequently
Pour mixture over asparagus bundles; sprinkle with fresh ground pepper
Bake 25 minutes until bacon is cooked
Garnish with sliced green onions (optional)

title: Creamy Cauliflower Dip
description: Delicious, light and fluffy appetizer suitable for holiday meals or parties.
ingredients: 1 medium cauliflower head, cut into 1-inch pieces
1/4 cup olive oil, divided (plus more for serving)
Baby romaine, endive, celery, crackers, or pita (for serving)
instructions: Boil cauliflower and garlic in 1/4" water for ~10 minutes until tender; drain
Sauté onion with cumin and salt in 2 Tbsp oil (3 min medium, 5 min medium-high)
Blend onion mixture with yogurt, lemon zest/juice, cauliflower, salt, and 2 Tbsp oil until smooth; adjust consistency with water if needed
Cool to room temperature, then serve in bowl drizzled with oil, topped with parsley, alongside vegetables and crackers

title: Beetsiki
description: Our spin on Tsatsiki - a tangy dip with a beautiful pink hue, served on mini sandwiches, celery sticks, or pita chips.
instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees
Remove beet stems, leaving 1 inch attached
Place beets in pan with 1/2 cup cold water; cover
Bake 35-40 minutes until tender
Drain beets in colander; rinse with cold water
Rub beets with fingers to remove skins
Combine garlic, lemon juice, yogurt, olive oil, and dill in mixing bowl
Grate beets and add to bowl; mix well
Cover and refrigerate
Garnish with extra dill before serving

title: Roasted Okra and Tomatoes
description: Finish up the last of the okra harvest with this delicious pairing of tomatoes and roasted to perfection!
ingredients: 1 pound okra, sliced horizontally in half
1 pint cherry tomatoes, sliced in half
instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F, selecting roast setting if available
Slice okra and tomatoes; arrange on cookie sheet
Drizzle with olive oil; sprinkle salt and pepper; toss by hand
Roast for approximately 10 minutes
Shake pan to rotate vegetables for even charring
Roast additional 5 minutes

title: Lemon Parsley Potatoes
description: French fries' sophisticated older brother with crispy, savory qualities but with added layers of flavor and less guilt. Pairs well with roasted or grilled meat.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F; line cookie sheet with parchment paper
Wash produce; dice potatoes into 1.5-inch cubes in mixing bowl
Chop parsley; set aside
Peel and mince garlic; add to small bowl with oil, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes
Zest lemon into oil mixture; squeeze juice in
Whisk until combined; pour mixture over potatoes and toss
Add parsley; toss to coat
Distribute evenly on lined sheet with spacing
Roast 15 minutes; turn potatoes; roast additional 15 minutes until golden
Serve with parmesan or alone

title: Breakfast Skillet
description: A customizable, veggie-packed breakfast ideal for groups. Works for Saturday brunch or brinner (breakfast for dinner). Pairs well with fresh juice or mimosas.
ingredients: 1 lb spicy ground sausage (breakfast or chorizo)
5 small sweet peppers or 1 bell pepper
garnish: Sour cream or plain Greek yogurt
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F
Dice potatoes, drizzle with olive oil, bake on parchment for 30 minutes until tender
Brown sausage in iron skillet
Add diced onion and pepper; cook until tender
Add kale; cook until bright green
Switch oven to high broil
Crack eggs into mixture; broil until egg whites become opaque
Serve immediately

title: Tuscan Kale Soup
description: This delicious dish will transport you to the streets of Italy with kale as the centerpiece providing nutritious and flavorful elements perfect for autumn evenings.
ingredients: 4 chicken or turkey sausage links (Italian style preferred), casings removed
2 cans cannellini or great northern beans
instructions: Heat olive oil in pot over medium heat
Cook garlic and onions until translucent
Brown sausage with garlic/onions; retain fat
Add beans, stir to combine
Incorporate kale, cook until bright green
Pour in stock, simmer until heated through
Stir in milk before serving
Season with salt, pepper, red pepper flakes
Serve with parmesan and crusty bread

title: Fall Kale Salad
description: A seasonal salad combining sweet, savory, crisp and cruciferous flavors. Works as a vegetarian lunch or pairs with roasted pork or chicken for dinner.
instructions: Cube and roast butternut squash with olive oil and salt
Chop kale; slice apples into matchstick pieces and onion thinly
Combine all ingredients in salad bowl; top with nuts, fruits, and cheese
Whisk dressing ingredients together separately
Pour dressing over salad and toss
Serve immediately

title: Fall Squash Bake
description: A ratatouille-style side dish featuring simmering Italian spices of roasted squash and tomatoes. Pair with cooked chicken sausage for a complete autumn meal.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F on roasting setting
Slice squash, zucchini, and tomatoes
Layer vegetables in cast iron skillet in circular pattern, alternating squash, zucchini, and tomatoes until full
Sprinkle with garlic, Italian seasoning, and parmesan cheese
Drizzle with olive oil
Bake 20 minutes, then sprinkle additional parmesan cheese
Bake additional 5 minutes until cheese is slightly browned

title: Sweet Potato Simmer
description: A protein-packed vegetarian dish featuring roasted vegetables and chickpeas. Showcases sweet potatoes, eggplant and chickpeas combined in a flavorful simmer.
ingredients: 2 red bell peppers, seeded and cubed
15 oz chickpeas (1 can), drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F
Cut sweet potatoes, eggplant, and bell peppers into 1/2-inch pieces
Divide between 2 baking sheets in even layer; drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper
Bake 25 minutes, flipping halfway through
Heat olive oil in large pot over medium heat; cook onion 3-4 minutes until semi-translucent
Add tomato paste, stir well, then add garlic, paprika, salt, and pepper; cook 2-3 minutes
Add chickpeas, tomatoes, and vegetable broth; cover and simmer 15 minutes
Add roasted vegetables; cook 5-10 minutes until tomatoes break down
Serve in bowls topped with parsley

title: Cocoa Banana Mini Loaves
description: A new and improved fall favorite combining chocolate and banana for a holiday dessert that transforms overripe bananas into an elegant treat.
ingredients: 1/4 pound (1 stick) unsalted butter, melted and cooled
1/2 cup chopped toasted walnuts or pecans (optional)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F
Combine flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt; set aside
Mash bananas with sugar until blended
Add butter, eggs, and vanilla to banana mixture; mix thoroughly
Gradually incorporate flour mixture by hand
Fold in nuts if using
Pour into prepared pans
Bake 35-40 minutes (mini loaves) or 60 minutes (standard pan) until firm and toothpick tests clean
equipment: Mini loaf pans (4) or standard loaf pan

title: Sweet Potato Hummus
description: A perfect snack time addition featuring salty, sweet, spicy, and sour flavors in one Mediterranean-inspired dip packed with superfoods.
instructions: Prick potatoes with fork; microwave until soft (approximately 12 minutes), flipping halfway. Cool completely.
Combine tahini and olive oil in a bowl; set aside.
Cut potatoes and scoop insides into food processor. Blend with water, lemon juice, garlic, paprika, 3/4 teaspoon salt, coriander, cumin, and chili powder until smooth.
With processor running, slowly add tahini mixture until combined.
Transfer to bowl; let rest 30 minutes for flavors to blend.
Serve with crackers or chips.

title: Holy Moly Guacamole
description: A zesty guacamole featuring fresh avocados, jalapeños, lime, cilantro, and tomatoes—ideal for homemade Taco Tuesday celebrations.
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine avocados and lime juice; mash to desired consistency
Add salt and cumin to the mixture
Finely chop garlic and red onion; quarter cherry tomatoes and add to bowl
Chop cilantro and incorporate; add diced jalapeño for extra heat if desired
Mix thoroughly and serve

title: Arugula, Orange and Roasted Beet Salad
description: Lettuce turnip the beet - a colorful salad combining roasted beets, fresh oranges, arugula, and goat cheese.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Wrap beets in foil individually and roast for 50 minutes to 1 hour until tender. Cool for 10 minutes, then peel with a knife.
Whisk vinegars, olive oil, 2 tsp salt, and 1 tsp pepper for dressing.
Slice warm beets into 4-6 wedges. Toss with half the vinaigrette, 1 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp pepper. Peel and cut oranges into 6-8 wedges.
Toss arugula and lettuce with remaining vinaigrette in a separate bowl.
Arrange greens on a platter; top with beets, oranges, walnuts, and goat cheese. Drizzle with additional vinaigrette and serve warm or at room temperature.

title: Roasted Red Pepper Soup
description: A refreshing springtime soup featuring light and refreshing flavors perfect for spring dining with fresh produce ingredients.
ingredients: 2 large red bell peppers, roasted, seeds removed
1/2 tsp Italian seasoning (oregano, basil, rosemary, thyme)
1 1/2 cups fat-free chicken broth or vegetable stock
1 medium sweet potato, peeled and chopped
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Roast peppers over flame or grill until skin turns black; place in covered bowl for 10 minutes, then peel and core
Heat oil in large pot over medium-high heat; sauté onions, carrots, garlic, and herbs until onions are translucent (~5 minutes)
Add broth, roasted peppers, sweet potato, and wine; bring to simmer
Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer 30 minutes until potatoes are tender
Add sour cream and blend until smooth with immersion blender
Season with salt and pepper; ladle into bowls and top with cheese

title: Roasted Fennel with Olives
description: By roasting the fennel, you bring out its naturally sweet flavor. Paired with the beloved, rich taste of kalamata olives and herbs, each bite is anything but simple.
ingredients: 1 fennel bulb, trimmed and cut vertically into 8 wedges with core intact
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F; spray baking sheet with nonstick spray
Combine fennel, olive oil, garlic, thyme, and red pepper in bowl; toss to coat
Spread fennel on baking sheet; sprinkle with salt and pepper
Roast 15 minutes
Flip wedges; continue roasting approximately 20 minutes until tender
Add olives; roast 8 minutes longer until edges brown
Season with salt and pepper; transfer to serving bowl

title: Stuffed Cabbage Soup
description: A hearty, rainy day meal described as perfect for feeling satisfied, ideal for rainy weather, and simply delicious.
ingredients: 1 pound ground beef or ground turkey
instructions: Heat olive oil in large pot over medium-high heat
Brown ground beef (4 minutes), seasoned with salt and pepper
Add onion and garlic, cooking 2-3 minutes
Add cabbage, carrots, broth, tomato sauce, rice, and bay leaf
Season to taste, bring to simmer, cook 25 minutes until rice is tender
Remove and discard bay leaf

title: Fennel, Cabbage and Apple Slaw
description: The perfect warm weather side - a crunchy, zesty, and sweet dish featuring fennel as the star ingredient.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper (to taste)
1/2 medium head green cabbage, cored, halved lengthwise, thinly sliced (about 6 cups)
1 green apple, quartered, cored, thinly sliced
1 medium fennel bulb, halved, cored, thinly sliced (about 2 cups)
instructions: Whisk together lemon juice and zest, mustard, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp pepper in a small bowl
Slowly add olive oil while whisking to emulsify
Combine cabbage, apple, and fennel in a large serving bowl
Just before serving, gently toss salad with dressing
Season with additional salt and pepper to taste
Sprinkle pecans on top and serve

title: Italian Tomato Salad
description: The perfect combination of fresh herbs, tomatoes, and mozzarella cheese.
ingredients: 2 medium ripe avocados, peeled and diced
instructions: Chop all fresh herbs, tomatoes, and cheese as needed. Combine in large mixing bowl.
In small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, oil, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle dressing over tomato mixture and toss to coat.
Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour before serving.
Add avocados just before serving, toss, and enjoy.

title: Apple Spinach Salad
description: Perfect summer salad with apple cider vinaigrette designed for summer occasions.
instructions: Combine all vinaigrette ingredients in a mixing bowl and whisk together, or add to a mason jar and shake.
Thinly slice apples, strawberries, and onions.
Mix sliced ingredients with spinach, half the cheese, and walnuts in a large bowl.
Drizzle with vinaigrette and toss.
Serve immediately; garnish with remaining cheese and optional protein.
